X(ω) = ∫x(t)e^(-jωt)dt

Integrate from -∞ to +∞. Converts time to frequency domain.

x(t) = (1/2π)∫X(ω)e^(jωt)dω

Inverse transform. Note the 1/(2π) factor.

1

Impulse has flat spectrum—contains all frequencies equally.

2πδ(ω)

Constant has energy only at DC. Dual of F{δ}=1.

sinc function

Rectangle in time → sinc in frequency. Narrow pulse → wide spectrum.

x*h ↔ X·H

Convolution in time = multiplication in frequency. Key simplification for LTI analysis.

dx/dt ↔ jωX(ω)

Differentiation multiplies by jω. Amplifies high frequencies.

x(t-t₀) ↔ X(ω)e^(-jωt₀)

Delay adds linear phase. Magnitude unchanged.

x(t)e^(jω₀t) ↔ X(ω-ω₀)

Modulation shifts spectrum. Basis of radio transmission.

∫|x|²dt = (1/2π)∫|X|²dω

Energy same in both domains. |X|² is energy spectral density.
